segments.content:
* **React**: A good variety of articles, and great releases from React Router and React Aria.
* **React Native**: Lots of cool things happening, and the community reacting to Lynx.
* **Other**: TypeScript announcing an exciting port to Go.

segments.content: This React Router release introduces a major new middleware feature. Itâ€™s not production-ready yet but you can turn it on with the `future.unstable_middleware` future flag. You can use it in framework or library mode. Thereâ€™s a distinction between client and server middleware. You can use it to implement logging, authentication, and other cross-cutting concerns.
segments.sourceMdx: This React Router release introduces a major new middleware feature. Itâ€™s not production-ready yet but you can turn it on with the `future.unstable_middleware` future flag. You can use it in framework or library mode. Thereâ€™s a distinction between client and server middleware. You can use it to implement logging, authentication, and other cross-cutting concerns.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [Product for Engineers - WTF is activation and why should engineers care?](https://dub.link/twir-mar12)
* ğŸ‘€ [React `moveBefore()` + `<ViewTransition>` demo](https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:hxmev3uady7j4litwnr5fzbg/post/3lk6phwfik226): This exciting browser feature permits to move/reorder DOM nodes while preserving their state (useful for video players, iframesâ€¦). It has been recently added to the DOM Living Standard, is supported in Chrome 133, and has just been enabled in the React DOM reconciler (experimental release only for now). I made a demo to see it in action combined with the upcoming ViewTransition component.
* ğŸ—“ï¸ [dotJS 2025](https://www.dotjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact)Â -Â ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Paris - 03 April -Â 3 weeks left before dotJS! Chat 1:1 with top contributors who are rarely in Europe â€“ Ryan Dahl, Wes Bos and more. Secure your spot now and get 15% off tickets with code "TWIRâ€.
* ğŸ—“ [StrapiConf](https://conf.strapi.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Paris - 13 May. Don't miss our keynote speaker reveal : SÃ©bastien Chopin, Matt Kane, Haris Ali Khan ! Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR".
* ğŸ“œ [React Router - Split Route Modules](https://remix.run/blog/split-route-modules): Explains how a new future flag enables React Router 7.2 to split a route module into multiple parts to avoid network waterfalls.
* ğŸ“œ [Beyond React.memo: Smarter Ways to Optimize Performance](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/beyond-react-memo-smarter-performance-optimization/): Before reaching for memoization, try to restructure your app and embrace composition.
* ğŸ“œ [Server Actions with Toast Feedback (useActionState)](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-server-actions-toast-useactionstate/): Exploring multiple ways to display a toast notification after a Server Action. I prefer this version, not relying on `useEffect`.
* ğŸ“œ [React Router error reporting from scratch](https://programmingarehard.com/2025/03/11/react-router-error-reporting.html/): A pretty cool article showing how to send React Router loader errors to an email address with a great DX, reading source maps and displaying original source code around the error for each stack frame. Lessons are applicable in other JS contexts.
* ğŸ“œ [How The New York Times systematically migrated from Enzyme into React Testing Library](https://open.nytimes.com/how-the-new-york-times-systematically-migrated-from-enzyme-into-react-testing-library-b3ea538d001c): Using an incremental migration strategy, starting with the simplest tests so that contributors have templates to get inspired from.
* ğŸ“œ [Rails views, web components, React. Why make a choice?](https://www.aha.io/engineering/articles/rails-views-web-components-react): Each technology has its sweet spot. They use React only for rich, stateful interactions.
* ğŸ“œ [How much traffic can a pre-rendered Next.js site really handle?](https://martijnhols.nl/blog/how-much-traffic-can-a-pre-rendered-nextjs-site-handle): Author load testing his self-hosted Next.js blog with pre-rendering and SSR to see how many requests per second it can handle.
* ğŸ’¸ [VS Code extension: Visualize how and where components (and their props) are used](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-mar-2025)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Aria - March 5, 2025 Release - Toast, Tree, Virtualizer, Tailwind 4, improved Autocomplete, Command Palette, DatePicker RTL, fix `usePress`, and more](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2025-03-05.html)
* ğŸ“¦ [Ark UI 5.0 - Cross-framework headless UI library - Now faster and smaller](https://ark-ui.com/react/docs/overview/changelog#:~:text=.-,%5B5.0.0%5D%20%2D%202025%2D03%2D06)
* ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington - React/Solid-JS Module Federation on TanStack!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e8yY9ZgPozw)
* ğŸ™ï¸ [Front-end Fire 84 - TanStack Form v1, ByteDance Debuts Lynx, & VS Code AI Levels Up](https://front-end-fire.com/episodes/84/)

segments.content: Reactile is an UI/UX turnkey framework which features an out-of-the-box, intuitive tiling display with workspaces. It encourages parallel workloads for large web solutions within a single browser tab. Implement your own view containers, widgets and logic using React and let Reactile handle the display for you.
segments.sourceMdx: Reactile is an UI/UX turnkey framework which features an out-of-the-box, intuitive tiling display with workspaces. It encourages parallel workloads for large web solutions within a single browser tab. Implement your own view containers, widgets and logic using React and let Reactile handle the display for you.

segments.content: On top of that, Reactile also offers:
segments.sourceMdx: On top of that, Reactile also offers:

segments.content:
* A promise-based persistence mechanism which permits a uniform workflow across time and on multiple devices.
* The possibility to use nested tabs for your tiles.
* A simplified global search mechanism.
* CSS @container based responsiveness.
* And much more.
segments.sourceMdx:
- A promise-based persistence mechanism which permits a uniform workflow across time and on multiple devices.
- The possibility to use nested tabs for your tiles.
- A simplified global search mechanism.
- CSS @container based responsiveness.
- And much more.

segments.content: Version 2 coming out soon. Get started with your unique 30-day free trial. Learn more about it on reactile.net.
segments.sourceMdx: Version 2 coming out soon. Get started with your unique 30-day free trial. Learn more about it on reactile.net.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [Introducing native Passkeys support for Expo - Unlock one of the fastest growing auth strategies for your next project](https://go.clerk.com/I4o9cHy)
* ğŸ§µ [Callstackâ€™s Lynx Deep Dive - The takeaways from a 3h livestream](https://threadreaderapp.com/thread/1898114457634500692.html)
* ğŸ“œ [How React Native Reanimated Updates the Styles](https://blog.swmansion.com/how-react-native-reanimated-updates-the-styles-a-deep-dive-338ab22e9f21): A deep dive explaining how UI and native props are handled differently
* ğŸ“œ [Local LLMs on Mobile Are a Gimmickâ€”For Now](https://www.callstack.com/blog/local-llms-on-mobile-are-a-gimmick): An overview of the challenges running AI models on-device, such as model size/format, CPU/battery consumption, and quality/speed tradeoffs.
* ğŸ“œ [Transitive Dependencies and React Native Autolinking](https://shift.infinite.red/transitive-dependencies-and-react-native-autolinking-d4d4b7a651cf): Transitive dependencies are not auto-linked for good reasons, and you need to declare them explicitly as `peerDependencies`.
* ğŸ“œ [How to build a solid test harness for Expo apps](https://expo.dev/blog/how-to-build-a-solid-test-harness-for-expo-apps): Helps you adopt the right mindset to test your RN apps.
* ğŸ“œ [React Native vs Lynx JS](https://shift.infinite.red/react-native-vs-lynx-js-b1fffb0f0152)
* ğŸ“œ [An Android Developer's Guide to React Native](https://dev.to/amazonappdev/an-android-developers-guide-to-react-native-j66)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native JavaScriptCore](https://github.com/react-native-community/javascriptcore): The Hermes runtime is widely used now, and the React Native team is extracting the JSC engine to a separate community repository. If you want to use JSC over Hermes, you can opt-in for it in RN 0.79. The built-in JSC will be removed in RN 0.81 or 0.82.
* ğŸ“¦ [Metro 0.82 - Enables `package.json#exports` resolution and lazy file hashing](https://github.com/facebook/metro/releases/tag/v0.82.0): Upgrade included in RN 0.79.
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Worklets 0.1](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/tree/main/packages/react-native-worklets): Software Mansion is extracting its Reanimated worklet system to a standalone multithreading library. WIP, weâ€™ll probably know more soon.
* ğŸ“¦ [Galeria 1.0 - Universal image viewer](https://github.com/nandorojo/galeria/releases/tag/v1.0.0): Supports New Arch, Web, and works with any image component.
* ğŸ“¦ [Zeego 3.0 - Universal menus/dropdowns](https://github.com/nandorojo/zeego/releases/tag/v3.0.1): Supports New Arch, RN 0.77, Expo 52
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Legal - Automagically generate dependency/license acknowledgment screens](https://github.com/callstackincubator/react-native-legal)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Executorch 0.3 - On-device AI experiences - Speech to Text, OCR](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-executorch/releases/tag/v0.3.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [Radon IDE 1.4 - React Query DevTools, React Scan re-render outliner, JS sampling profiler](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases/tag/v1.4.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [Testing Library 13.1 - React 19 / React Native 0.78 support](https://github.com/callstack/react-native-testing-library/releases/tag/v13.1.0)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Emoji Popup - using native primitives - MCEmojiPicker on iOS, Emoji2 on Android](https://github.com/okwasniewski/react-native-emoji-popup)
* ğŸ¥ [Theo - Lynx is incredible (deep dive into Tiktok's React Native killer)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=No0k-TMRuMA)
* ğŸ¥ [Simon Grimm - Is React Native in trouble? (Lynx, React Native Framework & Vercel)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aqgQatFPNSw)
* ğŸ¥ [Catalin Miron - Circular Carousel with Reanimated](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Va1yBFdUxI)
* ğŸ™ï¸ [React Native Radio 324 - Migrating to Expo with Alfred Lieth Ã…rÃ¸e](https://infinite.red/react-native-radio/rnr-324-migrating-to-expo-with-alfred-lieth-are)
* ğŸ™ï¸ [Rocket Ship 62 - Navigation, Styling & The State of React Native with Beto](https://share.transistor.fm/s/6a224b64)

segments.content:
* ğŸ“œ [Microsoft - A 10x Faster TypeScript](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/typescript-native-port/): The compiler is being ported to Go, should become 10x and land in TS 7.0. Learn more in this [Syntax.fm podcast](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZlGza4oIleY) interview with the TypeScript team, notably why they choose to use Go over Rust.
* ğŸ“œ [Web Almanac 2024 - JavaScript](https://almanac.httparchive.org/en/2024/javascript): The final chapter (JS) just dropped. React was found on 10% of pages (+25%) but still tiny compared to JQuery (74%).
* ğŸ“œ [Node just added TypeScript support. What does that mean for Deno?](https://deno.com/blog/typescript-in-node-vs-deno): The 2 runtimes support TS in different ways. For example, Deno has built-in type-checking and JSX/TSX support.
* ğŸ“œ [Inline rendering with documentâ€‹.currentScript](https://leanrada.com/notes/inline-rendering-currentscript/)
* ğŸ“œ [Reproducibility vs. Provenance: Trusting the JavaScript Supply Chain](https://blog.vlt.sh/blog/reproducibility)
* ğŸ“¦ [Fast-check 4.0 - Property-based testing framework](https://fast-check.dev/blog/2025/03/10/whats-new-in-fast-check-4-0-0/)
